sentence.Network_en: They'll demolish this house over my dead body.
sentence.Network_cn: 我死也不让他们拆这所房子.

in some neighborhoods , workers demolish old homes with little more than sledgehammers and their bare hands to make way for shopping malls , high-rise apartment complexes and new expressways .在一些社区，工人们仅用长柄铁锤或者徒手拆除旧建筑物，为购物中心、高层公寓住宅楼和新的高速公路项目准备场地。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French démoliss-, lengthened stem of démolir, from Latin demoliri, from de- (expressing reversal) + moliri 'construct' (from moles 'mass')

entry.tran: 摧毁，拆毁，拆除(建筑物等)
entry.def: To demolish something such as a building means to destroy it completely.

example.ex: A storm moved directly over the island, demolishing buildings and flooding streets...
example.tran: 暴风雨径直席卷该岛，摧毁了建筑，淹没了街道。

example.ex: The building is now being demolished to make way for a motorway.
example.tran: 为修建高速公路，现正拆除这栋建筑。

entry.tran: 驳倒，推翻(某人的观点或论点)
entry.def: If you demolish someone's ideas or arguments, you prove that they are completely wrong or unreasonable.

example.ex: Our intention was to demolish the rumours that have surrounded him...
example.tran: 我们的目的是要彻底击破围绕他的那些谣言。

example.ex: The myth that Japan is not open to concerns from outside has, I think, been demolished at a stroke.
example.tran: 关于日本对外界的关注不予理会的谬论，我认为，一下子就被驳倒了。

entry.def: If a person or team demolishes their opponents, they defeat them by a great amount.

example.ex: Millwall demolished Notts County 6-0 on Saturday.
example.tran: 周六米尔沃尔队以 6 比 0 大败诺茨郡队。

means.word_mean: 摧毁; 推翻; 拆毁(尤指大建筑物)

sentences.en: Terry Street was demolished a few years ago.
sentences.cn: 泰瑞街已在数年前拆掉。

jushi.english: Terry Street was demolished a few years ago.
jushi.chinese: 泰瑞街已在数年前拆除。

jushi.english: He demolished two big platefuls of chicken.
Unworthy buildings should be demolished to make room for modern construction.
jushi.chinese: 无价值的房屋应予以拆除，为现代建筑腾出地盘。
